meanings.definition: To strike repeatedly with the fists or a weapon.
meanings.sent1: He was pommelling the punching bag in the gym.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith was pommelling the hot iron to shape it.
meanings.sent3: The chef was pommelling the dough to make the perfect bread.
meanings.sent4: The waves pommelled the shore relentlessly during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The woodpecker pommelled the tree trunk looking for insects.

meanings.sent3: The baker pommelled the dough to make the fluffiest pastries.
meanings.sent4: The hail pommelled the roof, creating a deafening noise.
meanings.sent5: The boxer pommelled his opponent with powerful punches.

meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism pommelled his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The protesters pommelled the corrupt politician with questions.
